intro: Agalmyla rotundiloba, commonly known as the round-leaved agalmyla, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its rounded, thick leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
